Text: For the choirmaster. To the tune of ”Do Not Destroy.“ A Miktam of David. When he fled from Saul into the cave.
Context: This introductory note provides both the musical setting for the Psalm and the historical context of its composition, indicating a time of peril for David.

Text: Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy, for in You my soul takes refuge. In the shadow of Your wings I will take refuge until the destruction has passed.
Context: David expresses trust and seeks protection in God metaphorically, likening God to a bird sheltering its young.

Text: I cry out to God Most High, to God who fulfills His purpose for me.
Context: David’s appeal to God, recognizing His sovereignty and the fulfillment of divine purpose through his life.

Text: He reaches down from heaven and saves me, rebuking those who trample me. Selah God sends forth His loving devotion and His truth.
Context: David acknowledges God‘s intervention from a place of distress, suggesting God’s active role in defense and provision of steadfast love.

Text: I am surrounded by lions; I lie down among ravenous beasts—men whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.
Context: David describes his perilous situation by comparing his enemies to dangerous animals, emphasizing the severity of the threat.

Text: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let Your glory be over all the earth.
Context: A pivot from supplication to praise, David calls for God‘s exaltation that transcends the present danger.

Text: They spread a net for my feet; my soul was bowed down. They dug a pit before me, but they themselves have fallen into it. Selah
Context: David describes the plots against him, using the imagery of a trap, and notes the poetic justice of his enemies’ downfall.

Text: My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast. I will sing and make music.
Context: Expressing resolute confidence, David commits to praising God despite the circumstances.

Text: Awake, my glory! Awake, harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.
Context: David‘s joy leads him to awaken the day with music, signaling a new beginning or hope.

Text: I will praise You, O Lord, among the nations; I will sing of You among the peoples.
Context: David promises to praise God not only privately but also publicly, among other nations and peoples.

Text: For Your loving devotion reaches to the heavens, and Your faithfulness to the clouds.
Context: An expression of God’s vast love and faithfulness, likening them to the expansive sky.

Text: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; let Your glory be over all the earth.
Context: A repetition of verse 5, this praise forms an inclusio, framing the Psalm with a theme of God‘s supremacy and the desire for His renown.
